member.name: P:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.CudaControl.HintPath
member.summary: Optional path to try to load native provider binaries from. If not set, Numerics will fall back to the environment variable `MathNetNumericsCUDAProviderPath` or the default probing paths.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.CudaControl.UseNativeCUDA
member.summary: Use the OpenBLAS native provider for linear algebra. Throws if it is not available or failed to initialize, in which case the previous provider is still active.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.CudaControl.TryUseNativeCUDA
member.summary: Try to use the OpenBLAS native provider for linear algebra.
member.returns: True if the provider was found and initialized successfully. False if it failed and the previous provider is still active.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.CudaProvider.FreeResources
member.summary: Frees memory buffers, caches and handles allocated in or to the provider. Does not unload the provider itself, it is still usable afterwards. This method is safe to call, even if the provider is not loaded.

member.name: T:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider
member.summary: NVidia's CUDA Toolkit linear algebra provider.
NVidia's CUDA Toolkit linear algebra provider.
NVidia's CUDA Toolkit linear algebra provider.
NVidia's CUDA Toolkit linear algebra provider.
NVidia's CUDA Toolkit linear algebra provider.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.MatrixNorm(MathNet.Numerics.Providers.LinearAlgebra.Norm,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Computes the requested of the matrix.
member.param: The type of norm to compute.
The number of rows.
The number of columns.
The matrix to compute the norm from.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.DotProduct(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Computes the dot product of x and y.
member.param: The vector x.
The vector y.
member.returns: The dot product of x and y.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the DOT BLAS routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.AddArrays(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Does a point wise add of two arrays z = x + y. This can be used to add vectors or matrices.
member.param: The array x.
The array y.
The result of the addition.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.SubtractArrays(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Does a point wise subtraction of two arrays z = x - y. This can be used to subtract vectors or matrices.
member.param: The array x.
The array y.
The result of the subtraction.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.PointWiseMultiplyArrays(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Does a point wise multiplication of two arrays z = x * y. This can be used to multiple elements of vectors or matrices.
member.param: The array x.
The array y.
The result of the point wise multiplication.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.PointWiseDivideArrays(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Does a point wise division of two arrays z = x / y. This can be used to divide elements of vectors or matrices.
member.param: The array x.
The array y.
The result of the point wise division.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.PointWisePowerArrays(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Does a point wise power of two arrays z = x ^ y. This can be used to raise elements of vectors or matrices to the powers of another vector or matrix.
member.param: The array x.
The array y.
The result of the point wise power.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.AddVectorToScaledVector(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Adds a scaled vector to another: result = y + alpha*x.
member.param: The vector to update.
The value to scale by.
The vector to add to .
The result of the addition.
member.remarks: This is similar to the AXPY BLAS routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.ScaleArray(System.Numerics.Complex,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Scales an array. Can be used to scale a vector and a matrix.
member.param: The scalar.
The values to scale.
This result of the scaling.
member.remarks: This is similar to the SCAL BLAS routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.ConjugateArray(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Conjugates an array. Can be used to conjugate a vector and a matrix.
member.param: The values to conjugate.
This result of the conjugation.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.MatrixMultiply(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Multiples two matrices. result = x * y
member.param: The x matrix.
The number of rows in the x matrix.
The number of columns in the x matrix.
The y matrix.
The number of rows in the y matrix.
The number of columns in the y matrix.
Where to store the result of the multiplication.
member.remarks: This is a simplified version of the BLAS GEMM routine with alpha set to Complex.One and beta set to Complex.Zero, and x and y are not transposed.

member.summary: Multiplies two matrices and updates another with the result. c = alpha*op(a)*op(b) + beta*c
member.param: How to transpose the matrix.
How to transpose the matrix.
The value to scale matrix.
The a matrix.
The number of rows in the matrix.
The number of columns in the matrix.
The b matrix
The number of rows in the matrix.
The number of columns in the matrix.
The value to scale the matrix.
The c matrix.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUFactor(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Computes the LUP factorization of A. P*A = L*U.
member.param: An by matrix. The matrix is overwritten with the the LU factorization on exit. The lower triangular factor L is stored in under the diagonal of (the diagonal is always Complex.One for the L factor). The upper triangular factor U is stored on and above the diagonal of .
The order of the square matrix .
On exit, it contains the pivot indices. The size of the array must be .
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRF LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUInverse(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the inverse of matrix using LU factorization.
member.param: The N by N matrix to invert. Contains the inverse On exit.
The order of the square matrix .
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRF and GETRI LAPACK routines.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUInverseFactored(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Computes the inverse of a previously factored matrix.
member.param: The LU factored N by N matrix. Contains the inverse On exit.
The order of the square matrix .
The pivot indices of .
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRI LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUSolve(System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using LU factorization.
member.param: The number of columns of B.
The square matrix A.
The order of the square matrix .
On entry the B matrix; on exit the X matrix.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRF and GETRS LAPACK routines.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUSolveFactored(System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using a previously factored A matrix.
member.param: The number of columns of B.
The factored A matrix.
The order of the square matrix .
The pivot indices of .
On entry the B matrix; on exit the X matrix.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRS LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.CholeskyFactor(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the Cholesky factorization of A.
member.param: On entry, a square, positive definite matrix. On exit, the matrix is overwritten with the the Cholesky factorization.
The number of rows or columns in the matrix.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the POTRF LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.CholeskySolve(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using Cholesky factorization.
member.param: The square, positive definite matrix A.
The number of rows and columns in A.
On entry the B matrix; on exit the X matrix.
The number of columns in the B matrix.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the POTRF add POTRS LAPACK routines.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.CholeskySolveFactored(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using a previously factored A matrix.
member.param: The square, positive definite matrix A.
The number of rows and columns in A.
On entry the B matrix; on exit the X matrix.
The number of columns in the B matrix.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the POTRS LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.QRFactor(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Computes the QR factorization of A.
member.param: On entry, it is the M by N A matrix to factor. On exit, it is overwritten with the R matrix of the QR factorization.
The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
On exit, A M by M matrix that holds the Q matrix of the QR factorization.
A min(m,n) vector. On exit, contains additional information to be used by the QR solve routine.
member.remarks: This is similar to the GEQRF and ORGQR LAPACK routines.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.ThinQRFactor(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Computes the thin QR factorization of A where M > N.
member.param: On entry, it is the M by N A matrix to factor. On exit, it is overwritten with the Q matrix of the QR factorization.
The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
On exit, A N by N matrix that holds the R matrix of the QR factorization.
A min(m,n) vector. On exit, contains additional information to be used by the QR solve routine.
member.remarks: This is similar to the GEQRF and ORGQR LAPACK routines.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.QRSolve(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],MathNet.Numerics.LinearAlgebra.Factorization.QRMethod)
member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using QR factorization of A.
member.param: The A matrix.
The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
The B matrix.
The number of columns of B.
On exit, the solution matrix.
The type of QR factorization to perform.
member.remarks: Rows must be greater or equal to columns.

member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using a previously QR factored matrix.
member.param: The Q matrix obtained by calling .
The R matrix obtained by calling .
The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
Contains additional information on Q. Only used for the native solver and can be null for the managed provider.
The B matrix.
The number of columns of B.
On exit, the solution matrix.
The type of QR factorization to perform.
member.remarks: Rows must be greater or equal to columns.

The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
The B matrix.
The number of columns of B.
On exit, the solution matrix.

member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using a previously SVD decomposed matrix.
member.param: The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
The s values returned by .
The left singular vectors returned by .
The right singular vectors returned by .
The B matrix.
The number of columns of B.
On exit, the solution matrix.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.SingularValueDecomposition(System.Boolean,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Computes the singular value decomposition of A.
member.param: Compute the singular U and VT vectors or not.
On entry, the M by N matrix to decompose. On exit, A may be overwritten.
The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
The singular values of A in ascending value.
If is true, on exit U contains the left singular vectors.
If is true, on exit VT contains the transposed right singular vectors.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GESVD LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.EigenDecomp(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Numerics.Complex[])
member.summary: Computes the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a matrix.
member.param: Whether the matrix is symmetric or not.
The order of the matrix.
The matrix to decompose. The length of the array must be order * order.
On output, the matrix contains the eigen vectors. The length of the array must be order * order.
On output, the eigen values (Î») of matrix in ascending value. The length of the array must .
On output, the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix. The length of the array must be order * order.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Hint path where to look for the native binaries

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.IsAvailable
member.summary: Try to find out whether the provider is available, at least in principle. Verification may still fail if available, but it will certainly fail if unavailable.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.InitializeVerify
member.summary: Initialize and verify that the provided is indeed available. If calling this method fails, consider to fall back to alternatives like the managed provider.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.FreeResources
member.summary: Frees memory buffers, caches and handles allocated in or to the provider. Does not unload the provider itself, it is still usable afterwards.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.DotProduct(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Computes the dot product of x and y.
member.param: The vector x.
The vector y.
member.returns: The dot product of x and y.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.AddArrays(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Does a point wise add of two arrays z = x + y. This can be used to add vectors or matrices.
member.param: The array x.
The array y.
The result of the addition.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.SubtractArrays(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])

member.param: The array x.
The array y.
The result of the subtraction.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.PointWiseMultiplyArrays(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])

member.param: The array x.
The array y.
The result of the point wise multiplication.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.PointWiseDivideArrays(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])

The array y.
The result of the point wise division.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.PointWisePowerArrays(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Does a point wise power of two arrays z = x ^ y. This can be used to raise elements of vectors or matrices to the powers of another vector or matrix.

The array y.
The result of the point wise power.
member.remarks: There is no equivalent BLAS routine, but many libraries provide optimized (parallel and/or vectorized) versions of this routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.AddVectorToScaledVector(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Adds a scaled vector to another: result = y + alpha*x.
member.param: The vector to update.
The value to scale by.
The vector to add to .
The result of the addition.
member.remarks: This is similar to the AXPY BLAS routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.ScaleArray(System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Scales an array. Can be used to scale a vector and a matrix.
member.param: The scalar.
The values to scale.
This result of the scaling.
member.remarks: This is similar to the SCAL BLAS routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.ConjugateArray(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Conjugates an array. Can be used to conjugate a vector and a matrix.
member.param: The values to conjugate.
This result of the conjugation.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.MatrixMultiply(System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary: Multiples two matrices. result = x * y
member.param: The x matrix.
The number of rows in the x matrix.
The number of columns in the x matrix.
The y matrix.
The number of rows in the y matrix.
The number of columns in the y matrix.
Where to store the result of the multiplication.
member.remarks: This is a simplified version of the BLAS GEMM routine with alpha set to 1.0 and beta set to 0.0, and x and y are not transposed.

member.summary: Multiplies two matrices and updates another with the result. c = alpha*op(a)*op(b) + beta*c
member.param: How to transpose the matrix.
How to transpose the matrix.
The value to scale matrix.
The a matrix.
The number of rows in the matrix.
The number of columns in the matrix.
The b matrix

The number of columns in the matrix.
The value to scale the matrix.
The c matrix.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUFactor(System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Computes the LUP factorization of A. P*A = L*U.
member.param: An by matrix. The matrix is overwritten with the the LU factorization on exit. The lower triangular factor L is stored in under the diagonal of (the diagonal is always 1.0 for the L factor). The upper triangular factor U is stored on and above the diagonal of .
The order of the square matrix .
On exit, it contains the pivot indices. The size of the array must be .
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRF LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUInverse(System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the inverse of matrix using LU factorization.
member.param: The N by N matrix to invert. Contains the inverse On exit.
The order of the square matrix .
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRF and GETRI LAPACK routines.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUInverseFactored(System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Computes the inverse of a previously factored matrix.
member.param: The LU factored N by N matrix. Contains the inverse On exit.
The order of the square matrix .
The pivot indices of .
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRI LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.LUSolve(System.Int32,System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Double[])

The order of the square matrix .

The pivot indices of .
On entry the B matrix; on exit the X matrix.

member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using a previously factored A matrix.
member.param: The number of columns of B.
The factored A matrix.
The order of the square matrix .
The pivot indices of .
On entry the B matrix; on exit the X matrix.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GETRS LAPACK routine.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.CholeskyFactor(System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the Cholesky factorization of A.
member.param: On entry, a square, positive definite matrix. On exit, the matrix is overwritten with the the Cholesky factorization.
The number of rows or columns in the matrix.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the POTRF LAPACK routine.

member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using Cholesky factorization.
member.param: The square, positive definite matrix A.
The number of rows and columns in A.
On entry the B matrix; on exit the X matrix.
The number of columns in the B matrix.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the POTRF add POTRS LAPACK routines.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.CholeskySolveFactored(System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Solves A*X=B for X using a previously factored A matrix.
member.param: The square, positive definite matrix A.
The number of rows and columns in A.
On entry the B matrix; on exit the X matrix.
The number of columns in the B matrix.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.QRFactor(System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Single[])
member.summary: Computes the QR factorization of A.
member.param: On entry, it is the M by N A matrix to factor. On exit, it is overwritten with the R matrix of the QR factorization.
The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
On exit, A M by M matrix that holds the Q matrix of the QR factorization.
A min(m,n) vector. On exit, contains additional information to be used by the QR solve routine.
member.remarks: This is similar to the GEQRF and ORGQR LAPACK routines.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.ThinQRFactor(System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Single[])
member.summary: Computes the thin QR factorization of A where M > N.
member.param: On entry, it is the M by N A matrix to factor. On exit, it is overwritten with the Q matrix of the QR factorization.
The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
On exit, A N by N matrix that holds the R matrix of the QR factorization.
A min(m,n) vector. On exit, contains additional information to be used by the QR solve routine.
member.remarks: This is similar to the GEQRF and ORGQR LAPACK routines.

The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
The B matrix.
The number of columns of B.
On exit, the solution matrix.
The type of QR factorization to perform.
member.remarks: Rows must be greater or equal to columns.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.LinearAlgebra.CudaLinearAlgebraProvider.SingularValueDecomposition(System.Boolean,System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Single[])
member.summary: Computes the singular value decomposition of A.
member.param: Compute the singular U and VT vectors or not.
On entry, the M by N matrix to decompose. On exit, A may be overwritten.
The number of rows in the A matrix.
The number of columns in the A matrix.
The singular values of A in ascending value.
If is true, on exit U contains the left singular vectors.
If is true, on exit VT contains the transposed right singular vectors.
member.remarks: This is equivalent to the GESVD LAPACK routine.

member.summary: Computes the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a matrix.
member.param: Whether the matrix is symmetric or not.
The order of the matrix.
The matrix to decompose. The length of the array must be order * order.
On output, the matrix contains the eigen vectors. The length of the array must be order * order.
On output, the eigen values (Î») of matrix in ascending value. The length of the array must .
On output, the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix. The length of the array must be order * order.

member.name: T:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.SafeNativeMethods
member.summary: P/Invoke methods to the native math libraries.

member.name: F:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.CUDA.SafeNativeMethods.DllName
member.summary: Name of the native DLL.

member.name: T:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.Common.NativeProviderLoader
member.summary: Helper class to load native libraries depending on the architecture of the OS and process.

member.name: F:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.Common.NativeProviderLoader.NativeHandles
member.summary: Dictionary of handles to previously loaded libraries,

member.name: P:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.Common.NativeProviderLoader.LastException
member.summary: If the last native library failed to load then gets the corresponding exception which occurred or null if the library was successfully loaded.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.Common.NativeProviderLoader.TryLoad(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Load the native library with the given filename.
member.param: The file name of the library to load.
Hint path where to look for the native binaries. Can be null.
member.returns: True if the library was successfully loaded or if it has already been loaded.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.Common.NativeProviderLoader.TryLoadFromDirectory(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Try to load a native library by providing its name and a directory. Tries to load an implementation suitable for the current CPU architecture and process mode if there is a matching subfolder.
member.returns: True if the library was successfully loaded or if it has already been loaded.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.Common.NativeProviderLoader.TryLoadDirect(System.String)
member.summary: Try to load a native library by only the file name of the library.
member.returns: True if the library was successfully loaded or if it has already been loaded.

member.name: M:MathNet.Numerics.Providers.Common.NativeProviderLoader.TryLoadFile(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Try to load a native library by providing the full path including the file name of the library.
member.returns: True if the library was successfully loaded or if it has already been loaded.
